name: Quest for the Gemblades
text:
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a creature, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gemblades.
Remove a quest counter from Quest for the Gemblades and sacrifice it: Put four +1/+1 counters on target creature.

name: Quest for the Goblin Lord
text:
Whenever a Goblin enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Goblin Lord.
As long as Quest for the Goblin Lord has five or more quest counters on it, creatures you control get +2/+0.

editions.flavor: A shrine to unchecked desire.

name: Quest for the Gravelord
text:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Create a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Quest for the Holy Relic
text:
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Holy Relic.
Remove five quest counters from Quest for the Holy Relic and sacrifice it: Search your library for an Equipment card, put it onto the battlefield, and attach it to a creature you control. Then shuffle your library.

name: Quest for the Nihil Stone
text:
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Nihil Stone.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has no cards in hand and Quest for the Nihil Stone has two or more quest counters on it, you may have that player lose 5 life.

name: Quest for Ula's Temple
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you may reveal it and put a quest counter on Quest for Ula's Temple.
At the beginning of each end step, if there are three or more quest counters on Quest for Ula's Temple, you may put a Kraken, Leviathan, Octopus, or Serpent creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Questing Phelddagrif
text:
{G}: Questing Phelddagrif gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Target opponent creates a 1/1 green Hippo creature token.
{W}: Questing Phelddagrif gains protection from black and from red until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Questing Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent may draw a card.

name: Question Elemental?
text:
Flying
Are you aware that when you say something that isn't a question, the player who first points out this fact gains control of Question Elemental?

editions.flavor: "What the . . . ?"

name: Quickchange
text:
Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

name: Quicken
text:
The next sorcery card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. (It can be cast any time you could cast an instant.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.
A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.
A skilled Izzet chronarch can carry out an epic vendetta between the fall of one hourglass grain and the next.

name: Quickening Licid
text:
{1}{W}, {T}: Quickening Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has first strike.

name: Quickling
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Quickling enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return another creature you control to its owner's hand.

name: Quicksand
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Not all deaths are etched with mythic meaning and iconic glory.
Not all deaths are etched with mythic meaning and iconic glory.

name: Quicksilver Amulet
text: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "Wonderful! You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."
Those who examine the amulet too closely have been known to become part of its ornate carvings.

name: Quicksilver Behemoth
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

name: Quicksilver Dagger
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player. You draw a card."

editions.flavor: The dwarves call their quicksilver techniques "improvisational weaponsmithing."
The dwarves call their quicksilver techniques "improvisational weaponsmithing."

name: Quicksilver Dragon
text:
Flying
{U}: If target spell has only one target and that target is Quicksilver Dragon, change that spell's target to another creature.
Morph {4}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Quicksilver Elemental
text:
{U}: Quicksilver Elemental gains all activated abilities of target creature until end of turn. (If any of the abilities use that creature's name, use this creature's name instead.)
You may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to pay the activation costs of Quicksilver Elemental's abilities.

name: Quicksilver Fountain
text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts a flood counter on target non-Island land he or she controls of his or her choice. That land is an Island for as long as it has a flood counter on it.
At the beginning of each end step, if all lands on the battlefield are Islands, remove all flood counters from them.

name: Quicksilver Gargantuan
text: You may have Quicksilver Gargantuan enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it's still 7/7.

editions.flavor:
"You know you have achieved true power if the sea itself seeks to emulate your greatness."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Quicksilver Geyser
text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret

name: Quicksilver Sea
text:
When you planeswalk to Quicksilver Sea or at the beginning of your upkeep, scry 4. (Look at the top four cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
Whenever you roll CHAOS, reveal the top card of your library. You may play it without paying its mana cost.

name: Quicksilver Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Return Quicksilver Wall to its owner's hand. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: "Ogg hit wall. Ogg no kill wall. Ogg hate wall!"

name: Quick Sliver
text:
Flash
Any player may cast Sliver spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: The directors of the Riptide Project wanted instant results on the sliver experiments. They got their wish.
The directors of the Riptide Project wanted instant results on the sliver experiments. They got their wish.

name: Quicksmith Genius
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.

name: Quicksmith Rebel
text: When Quicksmith Rebel enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: This artifact deals 2 damage to target creature or player" for as long as you control Quicksmith Rebel.

editions.flavor: "Let's add just a bit more stopping power."

name: Quicksmith Spy
text: When Quicksmith Spy enters the battlefield, target artifact you control gains "{T}: Draw a card" for as long as you control Quicksmith Spy.

editions.flavor: "Let's just broaden its surveillance lens."

name: Quiet Contemplation
text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, tap target creature an opponent controls and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Quiet Disrepair
text:
Enchant artifact or enchantment
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Destroy enchanted permanent.
• You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"Artifice has always stood upon nature's shoulders. Let us watch nature take a turn."
—Freyalise

"Artifice has always stood upon nature's shoulders. Let us watch nature take a turn."
—Freyalise

name: Quiet Purity
text: Destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"When the Kami of Utter Silence passes, walls lose their secrets. Scrolls lose their lessons. Tapestries lose their beauty. Where there was meaning, there is only stillness."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Quiet Speculation
text: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan

"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan

name: Quietus Spike

editions.flavor: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.

name: Quilled Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."

editions.flavor:
"They have long kept us under attack, but we do not lack for ammunition. The very bodies of our foes arm us against them."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

name: Quilled Wolf
text: {5}{G}: Quilled Wolf gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I know a ranger that thought to make a cloak of its hide. He ended up losing an eye for his trouble."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Quillmane Baku
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Quillmane Baku.
{1}, {T}, Remove X ki counters from Quillmane Baku: Return target creature with converted mana cost X or less to its owner's hand.

name: Quill-Slinger Boggart
text: Whenever a player casts a Kithkin spell, you may have target player lose 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"A good day in Goldmeadow is one in which I don't spend all evening picking quills out of my backside."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Quillspike
text: {B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from a creature you control: Quillspike gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: While it's true that a quillspike does heal the sick, it's just because it finds them tastier that way.

name: Quirion Druid
text: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

name: Quirion Dryad
text: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.

editions.flavor:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Quirion Elves
text:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Quirion Explorer
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

editions.flavor:
Fight with a friend at your back, steel in your hands, and magic in your veins.
—Quirion creed

Fight with a friend at your back, steel in your hands, and magic in your veins.
—Quirion creed

name: Quirion Ranger
text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor:
"I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately."
—Henry David Thoreau, Walden

"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

name: Quirion Sentinel
text: When Quirion Sentinel enters the battlefield, add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: All elvenkind stood against Phyrexia. The Quirion nation deployed its most spiritual adepts, who wielded the power of their native soil.

name: Quirion Trailblazer
text: When Quirion Trailblazer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "All that matters is the path ahead."

name: Qumulox
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying

editions.flavor: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

name: Rabble-Rouser
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is Rabble-Rouser's power.

name: Rabid Bite
text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

editions.flavor:
"You should have seen the look on both their faces."
—Morkamp, Lambholt innkeeper

name: Rabid Bloodsucker
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rabid Bloodsucker enters the battlefield, each player loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: She haunts the streets, wings spread wide, with carrion on her breath and blood in her eyes.

name: Rabid Elephant
text: Whenever Rabid Elephant becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

editions.flavor: When in doubt, stomp.

name: Rabid Rats
text: {T}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Every sentence in Volrath's prisons ends the same way.

name: Rabid Wolverines
text: Whenever Rabid Wolverines becomes blocked by a creature, Rabid Wolverines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Is there any other kind?

name: Rabid Wombat
text:
Vigilance
Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

name: Racecourse Fury
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn."

editions.flavor: Close finishes are settled by who can dismount and get to weapons first.

name: Rack and Ruin
text: Destroy two target artifacts.

editions.flavor:
"My people are bound by masters centuries dead. Each artifact we destroy is another link broken in that chain."
—Barb Tail, viashino heretic

name: Rackling
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Rackling deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.

editions.flavor: "This may hurt a little."

name: Radha, Heir to Keld
text:
Whenever Radha, Heir to Keld attacks, you may add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Run home, cur. I've already taken your master's head. Don't make me thrash you with it."
"Run home, cur. I've already taken your master's head. Don't make me thrash you with it."

name: Radiant, Archangel
text:
Flying, vigilance
Radiant, Archangel gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.

name: Radiant Essence
text: Radiant Essence gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a black permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Her beauty was the beauty of the Sun at midday, deadly to those who underestimated her strength."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

name: Radiant Flames
text: Converge — Radiant Flames deals X damage to each creature, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Radiant Flames.

editions.flavor: The fires of Zendikar are always hungry, and there is much on which they can feed.
The fires of Zendikar are always hungry, and there is much on which they can feed.

name: Radiant Fountain
text:
When Radiant Fountain enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"All peoples treasure a place where the weary traveler may drink in peace."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Radiant Kavu
text: {R}{G}{W}: Prevent all combat damage blue creatures and black creatures would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: When angered or frightened, it protects itself with a burst of blinding light.

name: Radiant Purge
text: Exile target multicolored creature or multicolored enchantment.

editions.flavor: The Shifting Wastes are Dromoka's domain. She will not tolerate intruders.

name: Radiant's Dragoons
text:
Echo {3}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Radiant's Dragoons enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.

name: Radiant's Judgment
text:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Radiate
text: Choose target instant or sorcery spell that targets only a single permanent or player. Copy that spell for each other permanent or player the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those permanents and players.

name: Radjan Spirit
text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Crawing, crawing,
For my crowse crawing,
I lost the best feather i' my wing
For my crowse crawing."
—Anonymous Scottish ballad

name: Rafiq of the Many
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gains double strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Many sigils, one purpose.
Many sigils, one purpose.

name: Ragamuffyn
text: Hellbent — {T}, Sacrifice a creature or land: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: They cut the stitches and give her sips of her brew. Then they sew her up again, and she's back to stirring.

name: Rag Dealer
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"After General Takeno found the Oathkeeper amidst the bamboo marshes, more scavengers braved the swamp's nezumi, oni, and kami in hopes of glory."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Rageblood Shaman
text:
Trample
Other Minotaur creatures you control get +1/+1 and have trample.

editions.flavor:
"I see a spark of pure rage. Soon that spark will spread from the depths of Kragma. Soon its fire will engulf the polis."
—Hira, street oracle

name: Rage Extractor
text:
({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)
Whenever you cast a spell with {P} in its mana cost, Rage Extractor deals damage equal to that spell's converted mana cost to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: New Phyrexia is an engine that both consumes and creates malice.

name: Rage Forger
text:
When Rage Forger enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other Shaman creature you control.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks, you may have that creature deal 1 damage to target player.

name: Rageform
text:
When Rageform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Rageform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

name: Ragemonger
text: Minotaur spells you cast cost {B}{R} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay. (For example, if you cast a Minotaur spell with mana cost {2}{R}, it costs {2} to cast.)

name: Rage Nimbus
text:
Defender, flying
{1}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

editions.flavor: The settlement knew there was something strange about the cloud when the old priest Mandli suddenly grabbed an axe and ran screaming into the hills.

name: Rage of Purphoros
text: Rage of Purphoros deals 4 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Rage Reflection
text: Creatures you control have double strike.

editions.flavor: Vengeance is a dish best served twice.
Vengeance is a dish best served twice.

name: Rage Thrower
text: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: "Some lament these haunted times, but I'm a geistflame-tank-half-full kind of person."

name: Rage Weaver
text: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor: "Let my passion spur your victory."
"Let my passion spur your victory."

name: Ragged Veins
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, its controller loses that much life.

editions.flavor: "Sometimes the bulls win, and sometimes the bears win. But the bulls have more fun." —Anonymous

—Femeref children's myth

text:
Flash
Haste

editions.flavor: It took Yavimaya a thousand years to breed them, but it took only seconds for them to prove their worth.

name: Raging Minotaur
text: Haste

editions.flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.
The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.

name: Raging Ravine
text:
Raging Ravine enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Raging Ravine becomes a 3/3 red and green Elemental creature with "Whenever this creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it." It's still a land.

name: Raging River
text: Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, each defending player divides all creatures without flying he or she controls into a "left" pile and a "right" pile. Then, for each attacking creature you control, choose "left" or "right." That creature can't be blocked this combat except by creatures with flying and creatures in a pile with the chosen label.

name: Raging Spirit
text: {2}: Raging Spirit becomes colorless until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Its burning power is more elusive than shade on the Unyaro Plains, more perilous than the horn of a rhino."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Rag Man
text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

editions.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: "On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."
"On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."

name: Rags
text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

name: Raid Bombardment
text: Whenever a creature you control with power 2 or less attacks, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to defending player.

editions.flavor: Goblins in the first wave of a fire raid always bemoan the aim of everyone else.

name: Raiders' Spoils
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay 1 life. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"To conquer is to eat."
—Edicts of Ilagra

name: Raiding Nightstalker
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"Our steeds need food, water, stabling. Theirs just need prey."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Raiding Party
text:
Raiding Party can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
Sacrifice an Orc: Each player may tap any number of untapped white creatures he or she controls. For each creature tapped this way, that player chooses up to two Plains. Then destroy all Plains that weren't chosen this way by any player.

name: Rainbow Crow
text:
Flying
{1}: Rainbow Crow becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.

name: Rainbow Efreet
text:
Flying
{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)

"A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."
